page.title: 10Yarm Community Centre
page.content: Before the 2nd World War unemployment was a lot worse than it is now. It was not the young that were affected but the fathers with families to keep. Some wealthy people put some money together and gave it to the unemployed. The unemployed then built the social centre. It has been there ever since.It is now run by a management committee of 16 members. There are lots of people who use the centre regularly, a theatre group, a rabbit club, there is an antique fair on once a month and a ladies flower club. There is also bingo, craft fairs a keep fit club and a karate club and the WI (Woman's institution). It is sometimes used for children's parties discos, concerts and fashion shows.
